original: Majjhima Nikāya 85
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Bodhirājakumārasutta
analyzed: bodhirājakumārasutta
translated: With Prince Bodhi

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāra gire bhesakaḷā vane migadāye
translated: Once the Buddha was staying in the land of the Bhaggas in the deer park at Bhesakaḷā Grove.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bodhissa rājakumārassa kokanado nāma pāsādo acirakārito hoti anajjhāvuṭṭho samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā kenaci vā manussabhūtena.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena bodhissa rāja kumārassa kokanadaḥ nāma pāsādaḥ acirakāritaḥ hoti an ajjhāvuṭṭhaḥ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā kenacid vā manussa bhūtena
translated: At that time Prince Bodhi had recently built a palace called Kokanada, which had not yet been inhabited by any monastic or brahmin, or by any human at all.

original: Atha kho bodhi rājakumāro sañjikāputtaṁ māṇavaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bodhi rāja kumāraḥ sañjikāputtam māṇavam āmantesi
translated: Then Prince Bodhi addressed the student Sañjikāputta: 🔽“Please go to the Buddha and in my name bow down with your head at his feet. Ask him if he is free from illness or affliction, if he is strong, well-nourished, and living comfortably.

original: “ehi tvaṁ, samma sañjikāputta, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vanda, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ puccha:
analyzed: ehi tva samma sañjikāputta yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vanda appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram puccha
translated: Tell him:

original: ‘bodhi, bhante, rājakumāro bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchatī’ti.
analyzed: bodhi bhante rāja kumāraḥ bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati iti
translated: ‘Sir, Prince Bodhi bows down with his head at your feet. He asks if you are free from illness or affliction, if you are strong, well-nourished, and living comfortably.’

original: Evañca vadehi:
analyzed: evañca vadehi
translated: And say this:

original: ‘adhivāsetu kira, bhante, bhagavā bodhissa rājakumārassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā’”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu kira bhante bhagavā bodhissa rāja kumārassa svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: ‘Venerable Sir, would the Buddha and the Sangha of monks please accept tomorrow’s meal from Prince Bodhi?’”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho sañjikāputto māṇavo bodhissa rājakumārassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho sañjikāputtaḥ māṇavaḥ bodhissa rāja kumārassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: “Yes, sir,” Sañjikāputta replied. He then went to the Buddha, exchanged pleasantries with him,

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho sañjikāputto māṇavo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho sañjikāputtaḥ māṇavaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and sat down. He then said,

original: “bodhi kho rājakumāro bhoto gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati.
analyzed: bodhi kho rāja kumāraḥ bhoto gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati
translated: “Prince Bodhi bows down at the feet of Master Gotama. He asks after your health, whether you’re comfortable and well, strong, without distress, and living at ease.

original: Evañca vadeti:
analyzed: evañca vada iti
translated: And he says this:

original: ‘adhivāsetu kira bhavaṁ gotamo bodhissa rājakumārassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā’”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu kira bhavam gotamaḥ bodhissa rāja kumārassa svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: ‘Please accept tomorrow’s meal from Prince Bodhi together with the Sangha of monks.’”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho sañjikāputto māṇavo bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena bodhi rājakumāro tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bodhiṁ rājakumāraṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho sañjikāputtaḥ māṇavaḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā yena bodhi rāja kumāraḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bodhim rāja kumāram etat avoca
translated: Understanding the Blessed One’s consent, the brahmin student Sañjikāputta got up from his seat, went to Prince Bodhi, and told him what had happened.

original: “avocumha bhoto vacanena taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ:
analyzed: avocumha bhotaḥ vacanena tam bhavantam gotama
translated: “We said to the Master Gotama,

original: ‘bodhi kho rājakumāro bhoto gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati.
analyzed: bodhi kho rāja kumāraḥ bhoto gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati
translated: ‘Prince Bodhi bows down at the feet of Master Gotama with his head, and he asks after his ease, his comfort, his lightness, his strength, and his happiness,

original: Evañca vadeti—
analyzed: evañca vada iti
translated: and he says this:

original: adhivāsetu kira bhavaṁ gotamo bodhissa rājakumārassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā’ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu kira bhavam gotamaḥ bodhissa rāja kumārassa svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: May Master Gotama together with the Saṅgha of monks accept tomorrow’s meal from Prince Bodhi.’

original: Adhivuṭṭhañca pana samaṇena gotamenā”ti.🔽Atha kho bodhi rājakumāro tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ
analyzed: adhivuṭṭhan ca pana samaṇena gotamena ati  atha kho bodhi rāja kumāraḥ tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena sake nivesane paṇītam khādanīya
translated: And the recluse Gotama has consented.”🔽Then, when the night had passed, Prince Bodhi, having ordered exquisite staple and non-staple food prepared in his own home,

original: bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā, kokanadañca pāsādaṁ odātehi dussehi santharāpetvā yāva
analyzed: bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā kokanadam ca pāsādam odātehi dussehi santharāpetvā yāva
translated: having had the Kokanada Palace covered with white cloth

original: pacchimasopānakaḷevarā, sañjikāputtaṁ māṇavaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: pacchima sopāna kaḷevarā sañjikāputtam māṇavam āmantesi
translated: down to the last step of the staircase, addressed the brahmin student Sañjikāputta, saying:

original: “ehi tvaṁ, samma sañjikāputta, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocehi:
analyzed: ehi tva samma sañjikāputta yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā bhagavataḥ kālam ārocehi
translated: “Please go to the Buddha and announce the time, saying,

original: ‘kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan’”ti.
analyzed: kālaḥ bhante niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: ‘It’s time, Sir. The meal is ready.’”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho sañjikāputto māṇavo bodhissa rājakumārassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocesi:
analyzed: eva bhoti kho sañjikāputtaḥ māṇavaḥ bodhissa rāja kumārassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavataḥ kālam ārocesi
translated: “Yes, sir,” replied Sañjikāputta. He then went to the Buddha, announced the time,

original: “kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
analyzed: kālaḥ bho gotama niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: “It’s time, Sir. The meal is ready.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena bodhissa rājakumārassa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami.🔽Tena kho pana samayena bodhi rājakumāro bahidvārakoṭṭhake ṭhito hoti bhagavantaṁ āgamayamāno.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena bodhissa rāja kumārassa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami  tena khalu pana samayena bodhi rāja kumāraḥ bahidvāra koṭṭhake ṭhitaḥ hoti bhagavantam āgamayamānaḥ
translated: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to the house of Prince Bodhi,🔽where Prince Bodhi was standing outside the gateway, waiting for the Buddha.

original: Addasā kho bodhi rājakumāro bhagavantaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.
analyzed: addasā khalu bodhi rāja kumāraḥ bhagavantam dūratas uva āgacchanta
translated: He saw the Buddha coming and went out to meet him.

original: Disvāna paccuggantvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā purakkhatvā yena kokanado pāsādo tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: disvāna paccuggantvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā purakkhatvā yena kokanadaḥ pāsādaḥ tena upasaṅkami
translated: He bowed, and then he led the Buddha to the Kokanada stilt house.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pacchimaṁ sopānakaḷevaraṁ nissāya aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pacchimam sopānaka ḷevaram nissāya aṭṭhāsi
translated: The Buddha stood near the last step.

original: Atha kho bodhi rājakumāro bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:🔽“abhiruhatu, bhante, bhagavā dussāni, abhiruhatu sugato dussāni;
analyzed: atha khalu bodhi rāja kumāraḥ bhagavantam etat avoca  abhiruhatu bhante bhagavā dussāni abhiruhatu sugataḥ dussāni
translated: Prince Bodhi said to him,

original: yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
analyzed: yam mama dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: “Sir, please step on the cloths so that it will lead to my benefit and happiness for a long time.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi.🔽Dutiyampi kho …pe…
analyzed: evam vutte bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi  dutiyam pi kho pe
translated: The Buddha remained silent.

original: tatiyampi kho bodhi rājakumāro bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:🔽“abhiruhatu, bhante, bhagavā dussāni, abhiruhatu sugato dussāni;
analyzed: tatiyam pi khalu bodhi rāja kumāraḥ bhagavantam etat avoca  abhiruhatu bhante bhagavā dussāni abhiruhatu sugataḥ dussāni
translated: Prince Bodhi repeated his request a second and a third time,🔽and the Buddha remained silent.🔽Prince Bodhi then said,

original: yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.🔽Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ apalokesi.
analyzed: yam mama dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati  atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam apalokesi
translated: “Sir, please step on the cloths so that it will lead to my benefit and happiness for a long time.”🔽The Buddha looked at Venerable Ānanda,

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bodhiṁ rājakumāraṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ bodhim rāja kumāram etat avoca
translated: and Ānanda said to Prince Bodhi,

original: “saṁharatu, rājakumāra, dussāni;🔽na bhagavā celapaṭikaṁ akkamissati.
analyzed: saharatu rāja kumāra dussāni  na bhagavā cela paṭikam akkamissati
translated: “Please take back the cloths, prince.🔽The Buddha won’t step on them.

original: Pacchimaṁ janataṁ tathāgato anukampatī”ti.
analyzed: pacchimam janatam tathāgataḥ anukampati iti
translated: The Buddha has compassion for future generations.”

original: Atha kho bodhi rājakumāro dussāni saṁharāpetvā uparikokanadapāsāde āsanāni paññapesi.🔽Atha kho bhagavā kokanadaṁ pāsādaṁ abhiruhitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.🔽Atha kho bodhi rājakumāro buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
analyzed: atha kho bodhi rāja kumāraḥ dussāni saharāpetvā upari kokanada pāsāde āsanāni paññapesi  atha kho bhagavā kokanadam pāsādam abhiruhitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena  atha kho bodhi rāja kumāraḥ buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi
translated: Then Prince Bodhi had cloths brought and had seats prepared in the upper apartments of the Kokanada stilt house.🔽Then the Blessed One ascended to the Kokanada stilt house and sat down on the seat made ready.🔽Then Prince Bodhi, with his own hands, served and satisfied the Saṅgha of monks, with the Buddha at its head, with exquisite staple and non-staple food.

original: Atha kho bodhi rājakumāro bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho bodhi rāja kumāraḥ bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim aññataram nīcam āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: When the Blessed One had finished his meal and withdrawn his hand from the bowl, Prince Bodhi took a lower seat and sat to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho bodhi rājakumāro bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: eka mantam nisinnaḥ khalu bodhi rāja kumāraḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: As he was sitting there, he said to the Blessed One,

original: “mayhaṁ kho, bhante, evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: mayham kho bhante evam hoti
translated: “Lord, I think thus:

original: ‘na kho sukhena sukhaṁ adhigantabbaṁ, dukkhena kho sukhaṁ adhigantabban’”ti.
analyzed: na kho sukhena sukham dukkhena kho sukham adhigantabba nti
translated: ‘Happiness is not to be gained through happiness. Happiness is to be gained through suffering.’“

original: “Mayhampi kho, rājakumāra, pubbeva sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattasseva sato etadahosi:
analyzed: mayham pi kho rāja kumāra pubbā iva sambodhā an abhisambuddhassa bodhisattassa iva sataḥ etat ahosi
translated: “Before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I too thought thus:

original: ‘na kho sukhena sukhaṁ adhigantabbaṁ, dukkhena kho sukhaṁ adhigantabban’ti.
analyzed: na kho sukhena sukham dukkhena kho sukham adhigantabba nti
translated: ‘Happiness is not to be attained through happiness, happiness is to be attained through suffering.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, aparena samayena daharova samāno susukāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena🔽samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā akāmakānaṁ mātāpitūnaṁ assumukhānaṁ rudantānaṁ kesamassuṁ
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra aparena samayena daharaḥ uva samānaḥ su su kāḷa kesaḥ bhadrena yobbanena  samannāgataḥ paṭhamena vayasā akāmakānam mātā pitūnam assu mukhānam rudantānam kesa massu
translated: So, Prince, after some time, while still young, a black-haired young man endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life,

original: ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajiṁ.
analyzed: ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbaji
translated: against the wishes of my weeping and wailing parents, I shaved off my hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and went forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno kiṅkusalagavesī anuttaraṁ santivarapadaṁ pariyesamāno yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: saḥ evam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ kiṅkusala gavesī anuttaram santivara padam pariyesamānaḥ yena āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āḷāram kālāmam etat avoca
translated: Having gone forth thus, searching for what is wholesome, seeking the supreme state of sublime peace, I went to Āḷāra Kālāma and said to him:

original: ‘icchāmahaṁ, āvuso kālāma, imasmiṁ dhammavinaye brahmacariyaṁ caritun’ti.
analyzed: icchāmahe āvuso kālāma imasmin dhamma vinaye brahmacariyam caritun ti
translated: ‘Friend Kālāma, I want to lead the holy life in this Dhamma and Discipline.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, rājakumāra, āḷāro kālāmo maṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte rāja kumāraḥ āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ mam etat avoca
translated: When I had finished speaking, Āḷāra Kālāma said:

original: ‘viharatāyasmā,
analyzed: viharata ayasmai
translated: ‘Let the venerable one dwell in this Dhamma and Discipline.

original: tādiso ayaṁ dhammo yattha viññū puriso nacirasseva sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyā’ti.
analyzed: tādisaḥ ayam dhammaḥ yattha viññū purisaḥ nacirassa iva sakam ācariyakam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyya ati
translated: Such is this Dhamma that a wise person can soon enter and dwell in it himself, having experienced and attained it by his own super-knowledge.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, nacirasseva khippameva taṁ dhammaṁ pariyāpuṇiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra nacirassa iva khippam eva tam dhammam pariyāpuṇi
translated: “Then, Prince, I soon learned that Dhamma.

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, tāvatakeneva oṭṭhapahatamattena lapitalāpanamattena ñāṇavādañca vadāmi, theravādañca jānāmi passāmīti ca paṭijānāmi, ahañceva aññe ca.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra tāvatakena iva oṭṭha pahata mattena lapita lāpana mattena ñāṇa vādañca vadāmi thera vādañca jānāmi passāmi iti ca paṭijānāmi aham ca iva aññe ca
translated: “Then, Prince, I said: ‘I will speak with knowledge and assert with knowledge. I will speak with vision and assert with vision. I will speak with confidence and assert with confidence. I will speak with knowledge and assert with knowledge, and so will others.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: “Then, Prince, I thought:🔽‘Āḷāra Kālāma does not proclaim this Dhamma merely on the basis of hearsay,

original: ‘na kho āḷāro kālāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ kevalaṁ saddhāmattakena sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedeti;🔽addhā āḷāro kālāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ jānaṁ passaṁ viharatī’ti.
analyzed: na kho āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ imam dhammam kevalam saddhāmattakena sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti paveda iti  addhā āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ imam dhammam jānam passam viharati iti
translated: but he proclaims it having experienced and attained it by his own super-knowledge.

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, rājakumāra, yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: atha khvā āha rāja kumāra yena āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āḷāram kālāmam etat avoca
translated: Then, Prince, I went to Āḷāra Kālāma and asked him:

original: ‘kittāvatā no, āvuso kālāma, imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedesī’ti?
analyzed: kittāvatā no āvuso kālāme imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti pavedesi iti
translated: ‘In what way, friend, do you claim to have attained this Dhamma by realising it for yourself with direct knowledge?’

original: Evaṁ vutte, rājakumāra, āḷāro kālāmo ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ pavedesi.
analyzed: evam vutte rāja kumāraḥ āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ ākiñcaññāyatanam pavedesi
translated: When this was said, Rājakumāra, Āḷāra Kālāma proclaimed the base of nothingness.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:🔽‘na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi saddhā, mayhampatthi saddhā;
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ  na kho āḷārassa iva kālāmassa atthi saddhā mayham patthi saddhā
translated: Then, Rājakumāra, I thought:

original: na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi vīriyaṁ …pe…🔽sati …🔽samādhi …
analyzed: na kho āḷārassa iva kālāmassa atthi vīriyam pe  sati  samādhi
translated: ‘Āḷāra Kālāma does not claim to have attained this Dhamma by realising it for himself with direct knowledge.

original: paññā, mayhampatthi paññā.
analyzed: paññā mayham patthi paññā
translated: He has faith, energy, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.🔽I too have faith, energy, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ yaṁ dhammaṁ āḷāro kālāmo sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedeti tassa dhammassa sacchikiriyāya padaheyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham yam dhammaṃ āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti paveda iti tassa dhammassa sacchikiriyāya padaheyyanti
translated: Why shouldn’t I strive to realise that Dhamma for myself?’

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, nacirasseva khippameva taṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra nacirassa iva khippam eva tam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: So, Rājakumāra, in no long time—fast, I say—I attained that Dhamma, and directly knew it for myself.

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, rājakumāra, yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: atha khvā āha rāja kumāra yena āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āḷāram kālāmam etat avoca
translated: Then I went to Āḷāra Kālāma and asked him:

original: ‘ettāvatā no, āvuso kālāma, imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesī’ti?🔽‘Ettāvatā kho ahaṁ, āvuso, imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemī’ti.
analyzed: ettāvatā no āvuso kālāma imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi iti  ettāvatā kho aha āvuso imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi iti
translated: ‘Friend Kālāma, is it the case that by realising for myself with direct knowledge I here and now entered upon and abided in this Dhamma?’🔽‘It is by realising for myself with direct knowledge that I here and now have entered upon and abide in this Dhamma.’

original: ‘Ahampi kho, āvuso, ettāvatā imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmī’ti.
analyzed: aham pi kho āvuso ettāvatā imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti
translated: ‘Friend, it is by realising for myself with direct knowledge that I here and now have entered upon and abide in this Dhamma.’

original: ‘Lābhā no, āvuso, suladdhaṁ no, āvuso,
analyzed: lābhāḥ naḥ āvuso su laddham naḥ āvuso
translated: ‘It is a gain for us, friend, it is a great gain for us,

original: ye mayaṁ āyasmantaṁ tādisaṁ sabrahmacāriṁ passāma.
analyzed: ye mayam āyasmantam tādisam sabrahmacārim passāma
translated: that we see such a venerable elder living in companionship with such a venerable one.

original: Iti yāhaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi, taṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi.
analyzed: iti yā aham dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi tam tvam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi
translated: So the Dhamma that I have entered upon and abide in, having realised it for myself with direct knowledge, you also have entered upon and abide in, having realised it for yourself with direct knowledge.

original: Yaṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi, tamahaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi.🔽Iti yāhaṁ dhammaṁ jānāmi taṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ jānāsi; yaṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ jānāsi tamahaṁ dhammaṁ jānāmi.
analyzed: yam tvam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi tam aham dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi  iti yā aham dhammam jānāmi tam tvam dhammam jānāsi yam tvam dhammam jānāsi tam aham dhammam jānāmi
translated: I have realized this Dhamma for myself and I make it known to others.🔽I know the Dhamma that you know, and you know the Dhamma that I know.

original: Iti yādiso ahaṁ, tādiso tuvaṁ; yādiso tuvaṁ tādiso ahaṁ.
analyzed: iti yādisaḥ aha tādisaḥ yādisaḥ tuvam tādisaḥ aha
translated: I am like you, and you are like me.

original: Ehi dāni, āvuso, ubhova santā imaṁ gaṇaṁ pariharāmā’ti.
analyzed: ehi dāni āvuso ubhova santāḥ imam gaṇam pariharāma ati
translated: Come, friend, let us now lead this community together.’

original: Iti kho, rājakumāra, āḷāro kālāmo ācariyo me samāno attano antevāsiṁ maṁ samānaṁ attanā samasamaṁ ṭhapesi, uḷārāya ca maṁ pūjāya pūjesi.
analyzed: iti kho rāja kumāraḥ āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ ācariyaḥ me samānaḥ attanaḥ antevāsim mam samānam attanā samasamam ṭhapesi uḷārāya ca mam pūjāya pūjesi
translated: Thus, Prince, Āḷāra Kālāma, my teacher, while teaching me, placed me on an equal footing with himself, and he honored me with supreme honor.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: But, Prince, I thought:

original: ‘nāyaṁ dhammo nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṁvattati, yāvadeva ākiñcaññāyatanūpapattiyā’ti.
analyzed: na ayam dhammaḥ nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya savattati yāvat eva ākiñcaññāyatana upapattiyā ati
translated: ‘This Dhamma does not lead to disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to peace, to direct knowledge, to enlightenment, to Nibbana, but only to reappearance in the base of nothingness.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, taṁ dhammaṁ analaṅkaritvā tasmā dhammā nibbijja apakkamiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra tam dhammam an alaṅkaritvā tasmā dhammā nibbijja apakkami
translated: But I did not delight in that Dhamma, and after a short time I left.

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, kiṅkusalagavesī anuttaraṁ santivarapadaṁ pariyesamāno yena udako rāmaputto tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā udakaṁ rāmaputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra kiṅkusala gavesī anuttaram santivara padam pariyesamānaḥ yena udakaḥ rāmaputto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā udakam rāmaputtam etat avoca
translated: Searching for what is wholesome, seeking the supreme state of sublime peace, I went to Uddaka Ramaputta and said:

original: ‘icchāmahaṁ, āvuso, imasmiṁ dhammavinaye brahmacariyaṁ caritun’ti.
analyzed: icchāmahe āvuso imasmin dhamma vinaye brahmacariyam caritum ti
translated: ‘Friend, I want to lead the holy life in this Dhamma and Discipline.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, rājakumāra, udako rāmaputto maṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte rāja kumāraḥ udakaḥ rāma putto mam etat avoca
translated: When I had spoken, he said:

original: ‘viharatāyasmā,
analyzed: viharata ayasmai
translated: ‘The venerable one may stay here.

original: tādiso ayaṁ dhammo yattha viññū puriso nacirasseva sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyā’ti.
analyzed: tādisaḥ ayam dhammaḥ yattha viññū purisaḥ nacirassa iva sakam ācariyakam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyya ati
translated: This Dhamma is such that a wise man can soon realise for himself by direct knowledge the highest goal of the holy life for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, nacirasseva khippameva taṁ dhammaṁ pariyāpuṇiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra nacirassa iva khippam eva tam dhammam pariyāpuṇi
translated: So, Prince, before long I soon learned that Dhamma.

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, tāvatakeneva oṭṭhapahatamattena lapitalāpanamattena ñāṇavādañca vadāmi, theravādañca jānāmi passāmīti ca paṭijānāmi, ahañceva aññe ca.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra tāvatakena iva oṭṭha pahata mattena lapita lāpana mattena ñāṇa vādañca vadāmi thera vādañca jānāmi passāmi iti ca paṭijānāmi aham ca iva aññe ca
translated: And so, Prince, I claimed to know and see, and I spoke of knowing and seeing, simply on the basis of a mere rumour, a mere report.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘na kho rāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ kevalaṁ saddhāmattakena sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedesi;
analyzed: na kho rāmaḥ imam dhammam kevalam saddhāmattakena sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti pavedesi
translated: ‘Rāma did not declare that he had attained this Dhamma just through faith alone.

original: addhā rāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ jānaṁ passaṁ vihāsī’ti.
analyzed: addhā rāmaḥ imam dhammam jānam passam vihāsi iti
translated: Surely Rāma knew and saw this Dhamma himself.’🔽So I went to Uddaka Rāmaputta and asked him about this matter.

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, rājakumāra, yena udako rāmaputto tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā udakaṁ rāmaputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:🔽‘kittāvatā no, āvuso, rāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedesī’ti?
analyzed: atha khvā āha rāja kumāra yena udakaḥ rāmaputto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā udakam rāmaputtam etat avoca  kittāvatā no āvuso rāmaḥ imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti pavedesi iti
translated: He replied:

original: Evaṁ vutte, rājakumāra, udako rāmaputto nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ pavedesi.
analyzed: evam vutte rāja kumāraḥ udakaḥ rāma putto nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam pavedesi
translated: ‘Friend, it is in this way that I declare that I have attained this Dhamma, that I have fully realised it with my own insight.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘na kho rāmasseva ahosi saddhā, mayhampatthi saddhā;🔽na kho rāmasseva ahosi vīriyaṁ …pe…
analyzed: na kho rāmassa iva ahosi saddhā mayham patthi saddhā  na kho rāmassa iva ahosi vīriyam pe
translated: ‘Rāma had faith, but I have faith.

original: sati …
analyzed: sati
translated: Rāma had energy, but I have energy.🔽Rāma had mindfulness, but I have mindfulness.

original: samādhi …
analyzed: samādhi
translated: Rāma had concentration, but I have concentration.

original: paññā, mayhampatthi paññā.
analyzed: paññā mayham patthi paññā
translated: Rāma had wisdom, but I have wisdom.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ yaṁ dhammaṁ rāmo sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedeti tassa dhammassa sacchikiriyāya padaheyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham yam dhammam rāmo sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti paveda iti tassa dhammassa sacchikiriyāya padaheyyanti
translated: Why don’t I strive for the realization of that teaching that Rāma declared he had realized?’

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, nacirasseva khippameva taṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra nacirassa iva khippam eva tam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: And soon, before long, I had realized that teaching.

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, rājakumāra, yena udako rāmaputto tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā udakaṁ rāmaputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:🔽‘ettāvatā no, āvuso, rāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesī’ti?
analyzed: atha khvā āha rāja kumāra yena udakaḥ rāmaputto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā udakam rāmaputtam etat avoca  ettāvatā no āvuso rāmaḥ imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi iti
translated: I then went to Udaka Rāmaputta and said,🔽‘Is this as far as the venerable Rāma’s vision went when he declared that he had realized the utmost culmination of direct knowledge?’

original: ‘Ettāvatā kho, āvuso, rāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesī’ti.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho āvuso rāmaḥ imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi iti
translated: ‘Yes, that’s as far as my vision went.’

original: ‘Ahampi kho, āvuso, ettāvatā imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmī’ti.
analyzed: aham pi kho āvuso ettāvatā imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti
translated: ‘I too, friend, have attained this Dhamma directly and dwell having contacted it with the body.’

original: ‘Lābhā no, āvuso, suladdhaṁ no, āvuso,
analyzed: lābhāḥ naḥ āvuso su laddham naḥ āvuso
translated: ‘It’s a gain for us, friend, it’s a great gain for us,

original: ye mayaṁ āyasmantaṁ tādisaṁ sabrahmacāriṁ passāma.🔽Iti yaṁ dhammaṁ rāmo sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi taṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi.
analyzed: ye mayam āyasmantam tādisam sabrahmacārim passāma  iti yam dhammam rāmaḥ sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi tam tvam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi
translated: that we see a companion in the holy life like you.🔽So you have attained this Dhamma directly and dwell having contacted it with the body, just as Rāma declared that he had.

original: Yaṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi taṁ dhammaṁ rāmo sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi.
analyzed: yam tvam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi tam dhammam rāmaḥ sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi
translated: And Rāma declared that he had attained this Dhamma directly and dwelt having contacted it with the body, just as you have.

original: Iti yaṁ dhammaṁ rāmo abhiññāsi taṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ jānāsi; yaṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ jānāsi taṁ dhammaṁ rāmo abhiññāsi.
analyzed: iti yam dhammam rāmaḥ abhiññāsi tam tvam dhammam jānāsi yam tvam dhammam jānāsi tam dhammam rāmaḥ abhiññāsi
translated: So you know the Dhamma that Rāma knew, and Rāma knew the Dhamma that you know.

original: Iti yādiso rāmo ahosi tādiso tuvaṁ, yādiso tuvaṁ tādiso rāmo ahosi.
analyzed: iti yādisaḥ rāmaḥ ahosi tādisaḥ yādisaḥ tuvam tādisaḥ rāmaḥ ahosi
translated: You are just like Rāma, and Rāma was just like you.

original: Ehi dāni, āvuso, tuvaṁ imaṁ gaṇaṁ pariharā’ti.
analyzed: ehi dāni āvuso tuvam imam gaṇam parihara
translated: Now come, friend, and lead this community.’

original: Iti kho, rājakumāra, udako rāmaputto sabrahmacārī me samāno ācariyaṭṭhāne maṁ ṭhapesi, uḷārāya ca maṁ pūjāya pūjesi.
analyzed: iti kho rāja kumāraḥ udakaḥ rāma putto sabrahmacārī me samānaḥ ācariya ṭṭhāne mam ṭhapesi uḷārāya ca mam pūjāya pūjesi
translated: So, Prince, Udaka Rāmaputta, my fellow celibate, placed me in the teacher’s position and worshipped me with lofty worship.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: But, Prince, I thought:

original: ‘nāyaṁ dhammo nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṁvattati, yāvadeva nevasaññānāsaññāyatanūpapattiyā’ti.
analyzed: na ayam dhammaḥ nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya savattati yāvat eva neva saññā nāsañña āyatana upapattiyā ati
translated: ‘This Dhamma does not lead to dispassion, to disengagement, to cessation, to peace, to direct knowledge, to enlightenment, to Nibbāna, but only to the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, taṁ dhammaṁ analaṅkaritvā tasmā dhammā nibbijja apakkamiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra tam dhammam an alaṅkaritvā tasmā dhammā nibbijja apakkami
translated: So, Prince, I, not delighting in that Dhamma, left it and went away.

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, kiṅkusalagavesī anuttaraṁ santivarapadaṁ pariyesamāno, magadhesu anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno, yena uruvelā senānigamo tadavasariṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra kiṅkusala gavesī anuttaram santivara padam pariyesamānaḥ magadhesu anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena uruvelā senānigamaḥ tat avasari
translated: Now, Prince, as I was seeking what is wholesome, seeking the supreme state of sublime peace, wandering by stages in Magadha, I came to the town of Senāni.

original: Tatthaddasaṁ ramaṇīyaṁ bhūmibhāgaṁ, pāsādikañca vanasaṇḍaṁ, nadiñca sandantiṁ setakaṁ supatitthaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ samantā ca gocaragāmaṁ.
analyzed: ramaṇīyam bhūmibhāga pāsādikam ca vanasaṇḍa nadiñca sandantim setakam supatittha ramaṇīyam samantā ca gocaragāma
translated: There I saw a delightful piece of ground, a pleasing grove with a clear-flowing river with pleasant, smooth banks and nearby a village for alms resort.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘ramaṇīyo vata bho bhūmibhāgo, pāsādiko ca vanasaṇḍo, nadī ca sandati setakā supatitthā, ramaṇīyā samantā ca gocaragāmo.
analyzed: ramaṇīyaḥ vata bho bhūmi bhāgaḥ pāsādikaḥ ca vana saṇḍaḥ nadī ca sandati setakā su patitthā ramaṇīyā samantā ca gocara gāmaḥ
translated: ‘This is a delightful place, delightful.

original: Alaṁ vatidaṁ kulaputtassa padhānatthikassa padhānāyā’ti.
analyzed: alam vatidam kula puttassa padhānatthikassa padhānāya ati
translated: This is good enough for striving.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, tattheva nisīdiṁ:
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra tattha iva nisīdi
translated: So I sat down right there, thinking:

original: ‘alamidaṁ padhānāyā’ti.
analyzed: alam idam padhāna āyāti
translated: ‘This is good enough for striving.’

original: Apissu maṁ, rājakumāra, tisso upamā paṭibhaṁsu anacchariyā pubbe assutapubbā.🔽Seyyathāpi, rājakumāra, allaṁ kaṭṭhaṁ sasnehaṁ udake nikkhittaṁ.
analyzed: ma rāja kumāra tissaḥ upamā anacchariyā pubbe a ssuta pubbā  seyyathā api rāja kumāra allam kaṭṭham sa sneham udake nikkhitta
translated: Then, Prince, three similes occurred to me spontaneously, never heard before.

original: Atha puriso āgaccheyya uttarāraṇiṁ ādāya:
analyzed: atha purisaḥ āgaccheyya uttarāraṇim ādāya
translated: Suppose there were a green, sappy piece of timber lying in water, and a man came with an upper fire-stick, thinking:

original: ‘aggiṁ abhinibbattessāmi, tejo pātukarissāmī’ti.
analyzed: aggim abhinibbattessāmi tejaḥ pātukarissāmi iti
translated: ‘I shall light a fire, I shall produce heat.’

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, rājakumāra,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi rāja kumāra
translated: What do you think, Prince?

original: api nu so puriso amuṁ allaṁ kaṭṭhaṁ sasnehaṁ udake nikkhittaṁ uttarāraṇiṁ ādāya abhimanthento aggiṁ abhinibbatteyya, tejo pātukareyyā”ti?
analyzed: api nu saḥ purisaḥ amum allam kaṭṭham sa sneham udake nikkhittam uttarāraṇim ādāya abhimanthentaḥ aggim abhinibbatteyya tejaḥ pātukareyya ati
translated: Would that man be able to light a fire and produce heat by rubbing the green, sappy timber lying in the water with the upper fire-stick?”

original: “No hidaṁ, bhante.
analyzed: na u hida bhante
translated: “No, venerable sir.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?

analyzed: yat nūna aham appāṇakayā iva jhānam jhāyeyyanti  saḥ kho aha rāja kumāra mukhataḥ ca nāsataḥ ca kaṇṇataḥ ca assāsa passāse uparundhi  tassa mayha rāja kumāra mukhataḥ ca nāsataḥ ca kaṇṇataḥ ca assāsa passāsesu uparuddhesu adhimattāḥ vātāḥ kucchim parikantanti  seyyathā api rāja kumāra dakkhaḥ go ghātakaḥ vā go ghātaka antevāsī vā tiṇhena go vikantanena kucchim parikanteyya
translated: ‘Suppose I meditate on the in-&-out breath with a limited mind?’🔽So I blocked off the in-&-out breath through my mouth, nose, and ears.🔽As I did so, strong winds cut through my body,

translated: just as if a strong man were to cut through my body with a sharp sword.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, mukhato ca nāsato ca kaṇṇato ca assāsapassāsesu uparuddhesu adhimatto kāyasmiṁ ḍāho hoti.

analyzed: ye api hi keci etarahi samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanāḥ vedayanti etau aparamam nayitaḥ bhiyyas
translated: Whatever ascetics and priests at present experience painful, sharp, harsh, and bitter feelings due to exertion, this is the utmost, there is no more beyond that.

original: Na kho panāhaṁ imāya kaṭukāya dukkarakārikāya adhigacchāmi uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṁ;
analyzed: na kho pana aham imāya kaṭukāya dukkara kārikāya adhigacchāmi uttari manussa dhammā alam ariya ñāṇa dassana visesa
translated: But I do not attain any higher superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones through this painful practice that is hard on the body.

original: siyā nu kho añño maggo bodhāyā’ti.
analyzed: siyā nu kho aññaḥ maggaḥ bodhāya ati
translated: Could there be another path to Awakening?’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: Then, Prince, I thought:

original: ‘abhijānāmi kho panāhaṁ pitu sakkassa kammante sītāya jambucchāyāya nisinno vivicceva
analyzed: abhijānāmi kho pana aham pitu sakkassa kammante sītāya jambucchāyāya nisinnaḥ vivicca iva
translated: ‘I remember when I was sitting in the cool shade of the rose-apple tree, quite secluded from sensual pleasures,

original: kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ
analyzed: kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham
translated: quite secluded from sense desires, secluded from unwholesome things, he entered upon and abided in the first jhāna, which is with thinking and pondering, born of seclusion, filled with delight and joy,

original: jhānaṁ upasampajja viharitā;
analyzed: jhānam upasampajja viharitā
translated: I entered and dwelled in the first jhāna, which consists of rapture and pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by thought and examination.

original: siyā nu kho eso maggo bodhāyā’ti.
analyzed: siyā nu kho eso maggaḥ bodhāya ati
translated: I thought: ‘This is the path to awakening.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, satānusāri viññāṇaṁ ahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāra sata anusāri viññāṇam ahosi
translated: I had a sense of recollection of that past life,

original: ‘eseva maggo bodhāyā’ti.
analyzed: esa iva maggaḥ bodhāya ati
translated: but not of any further past life.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘kiṁ nu kho ahaṁ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi yaṁ taṁ sukhaṁ aññatreva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehī’ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho aham tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi yam tam sukham aññatra iva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehi iti
translated: ‘Why should I fear that pleasure which is other than worldly pleasures, other than unwholesome states?’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘na kho ahaṁ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi yaṁ taṁ sukhaṁ aññatreva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehī’ti.
analyzed: na kho aham tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi yam tam sukham aññatra iva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehi iti
translated: ‘I should not fear that pleasure which is other than worldly pleasures, other than unwholesome states.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘na kho taṁ sukaraṁ sukhaṁ adhigantuṁ evaṁ adhimattakasimānaṁ pattakāyena. Yannūnāhaṁ oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāreyyaṁ odanakummāsan’ti.
analyzed: na kho tam sukaram sukham adhigantum evam adhimattaka simānam patta kāyena yat nūna aham oḷārikam āhāram āhāreyyam odana kummā asanti
translated: ‘It is not easy to attain that pleasure with a body so excessively emaciated. Let me eat some solid food, some boiled rice and porridge.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāresiṁ odanakummāsaṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāraḥ oḷārikam āhāram odana kummāsa
translated: I ate that coarse food, the boiled rice and porridge.

original: Tena kho pana maṁ, rājakumāra, samayena pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū paccupaṭṭhitā honti:
analyzed: tena kho pana ma rāja kumāra samayena pañcavaggiyāḥ bhikkhū paccupaṭṭhitāḥ honti
translated: At that time the group-of-five monks were attending on me, thinking:

original: ‘yaṁ kho samaṇo gotamo dhammaṁ adhigamissati taṁ no ārocessatī’ti.
analyzed: yam kho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dhammam adhigamissati tam naḥ ārocessati iti
translated: ‘Whatever spiritual state the contemplative Gotama will attain, he will inform us first.’

original: Yato kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāresiṁ odanakummāsaṁ, atha me te pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamiṁsu:
analyzed: yatas kho aha rāja kumāraḥ oḷārikam āhāram āhāresim odana kummāsa atha me te pañcavaggiyāḥ bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamisu
translated: But when I ate that coarse food, the boiled rice and porridge, they were disgusted and left me, thinking:

original: ‘bāhulliko samaṇo gotamo padhānavibbhanto, āvatto bāhullāyā’ti.
analyzed: bāhullikaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ padhāna vibbhantaḥ āvattaḥ bāhullāya ati
translated: ‘The contemplative Gotama is intent on luxury. He has abandoned his earlier striving and reverted to luxury.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāretvā balaṁ gahetvā vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.🔽Vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā … dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ …🔽tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ …
analyzed: saḥ kho aha rāja kumāraḥ oḷārikam āhāram āhāretvā balam gahetvā vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja vihāsi  vūpasamā dutiyam jhānam  tatiyam jhānam
translated: But when I had eaten the coarse food, the boiled rice and porridge, and had regained my strength, secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, I entered and remained in the first jhāna: rapture and pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by directed thought and evaluation.

original: catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: catuttham jhānam upasampajja vihāsi
translated: As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, I entered and remained in the second jhāna: rapture and pleasure born of concentration, unification of awareness free from directed thought and evaluation.🔽As rapture fades away, I entered and remained in the third jhāna: I experienced pleasure with the body, and was mindful and equanimous.🔽As pleasure fades away, I entered and remained in the fourth jhāna: neither pleasure nor pain, purification of mindfulness by equanimity.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.🔽So anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi  saḥ aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi jātim dve pi jātiyaḥ pe iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi
translated: When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilements, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the recollection of past lives.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, rājakumāra, rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā
analyzed: ayam kho me rāja kumāra rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā
translated: I recollected my manifold past lives, i.e. one birth, two births, three births, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, one hundred, one thousand, one hundred thousand, many eons of cosmic contraction, many eons of cosmic expansion, many eons of cosmic contraction and expansion: ‘There I had such a name, belonged to such a clan, had such an appearance. Such was my food, such my sensitivity to pleasure and pain, such the end of my life. Passing away from that state, I re-arose there. There too I had such a name, belonged to such a clan, had such an appearance. Such was my food, such my sensitivity to pleasure and pain, such the end of my life. Passing away from that state, I re-arose here.’ Thus I remembered my manifold past lives in their modes and details.

original: vijjā adhigatā, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: vijjā adhigatā avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppanno yathā tam appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato
translated: This was the first knowledge I attained in the first watch of the night. From ignorance came knowledge, from darkness came light, as if from blind darkness came sight.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte sattānaṁ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte sattānam cutūpapāta ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi
translated: When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilements, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings.

original: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi …pe…
analyzed: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi pe
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I saw beings passing away and arising: inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate. I understood how beings pass on according to their actions thus: ‘These worthy beings who were ill-conducted in body, speech, and mind, revilers of noble ones, wrong in their views, giving effect to wrong view in their actions, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a state of deprivation, in a bad destination, in perdition, even in hell. But these worthy beings who were well-conducted in body, speech, and mind, not revilers of noble ones, right in their views, giving effect to right view in their actions, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a good destination, even in the heavenly world.’ Thus with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I saw beings passing away and arising: inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate. I understood how beings pass on according to their actions.

original: ayaṁ kho me, rājakumāra, rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: ayam kho me rāja kumāra rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppanno yathā tam appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato
translated: This was the second true knowledge I attained in the last watch of the night. Ignorance was banished and true knowledge arose, darkness was banished and light arose, as happens in one who abides diligent, ardent, and resolute.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṁ khayañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi
translated: “When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilements, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to the knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: So ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ …pe… ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ;
analyzed: so idam dukkhanti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsim pe ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is suffering’; … ‘This is the origin of suffering’; … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’; … ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering’; … ‘These are the taints’; … ‘This is the origin of the taints’; … ‘This is the cessation of the taints’; … ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of the taints.’

original: ‘ime āsavā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ …pe… ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: ime āsavā ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsim pe ayam āsava nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: I directly knew as it really is: ‘These are the taints.’ … I directly knew as it really is: ‘This is the path to the cessation of the taints.’

original: Tassa me evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha, bhavāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha, avijjāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha.
analyzed: tassa me evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccittha bhava āsavā api cittam vimuccittha avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccittha
translated: When I knew and saw this, my mind was liberated from the taint of sensual desire, from the taint of being, and from the taint of ignorance.

original: Vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam ahosi
translated: When it was liberated there came the knowledge: ‘It’s liberated.’

original: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: I directly knew: ‘Birth is ended, the spiritual life fulfilled, the job done. There is nothing further for this world.’

original: Ayaṁ kho me, rājakumāra, rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā
analyzed: ayam kho me rāja kumāra rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā
translated: This was the third knowledge I attained in the last watch of the night.

original: vijjā adhigatā, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: vijjā adhigatā avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppanno yathā tam appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato
translated: Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed; light arose—as happens for a conscientious, ardent, & heedful noble disciple while living heedfully.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: Then it occurred to me:

original: ‘adhigato kho myāyaṁ dhammo gambhīro duddaso duranubodho santo paṇīto atakkāvacaro nipuṇo paṇḍitavedanīyo.
analyzed: adhigataḥ kho myā ayam dhammaḥ gambhīraḥ duddasaḥ duranubodhaḥ santaḥ paṇītaḥ a takka avacaraḥ nipuṇaḥ paṇḍita vedanīyo
translated: ‘This Dhamma that I have attained is deep, hard to see, hard to realize, peaceful, refined, beyond the scope of conjecture, subtle, to-be-experienced by the wise.

original: Ālayarāmā kho panāyaṁ pajā ālayaratā ālayasammuditā.
analyzed: ālaya rāmā khalu pana ayam pajā ālaya ratā ālaya sammuditā
translated: People delight in clinging, take delight in clinging, rejoice in clinging,

original: Ālayarāmāya kho pana pajāya ālayaratāya ālayasammuditāya duddasaṁ idaṁ ṭhānaṁ yadidaṁ—idappaccayatāpaṭiccasamuppādo.
analyzed: ālaya rāmāya kho pana pajāya ālaya ratāya ālaya sammuditāya duddasam idam ṭhānam yat idam edappaccaya tā paṭiccasamuppādaḥ
translated: and it is hard for them to see the origin of the world that arises through conditions.

original: Idampi kho ṭhānaṁ duddasaṁ—yadidaṁ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
analyzed: idam api kho ṭhānam duddasayat idam sabba saṅkhāra samatho sabba upadhi paṭinissaggo taṇhā kkhayaḥ virāgaḥ nirodhaḥ nibbāna
translated: It is also hard for them to see the stilling of all processes, the relinquishing of all acquisitions, the destruction of craving, dispassion, cessation, Nibbāna.

original: Ahañceva kho pana dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, pare ca me na ājāneyyuṁ, so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana dhammam deseyya pare ca me naḥ ājāneyyu saḥ mamassa kilamatho sā mamassa vihesā ati
translated: If I were to teach the Dhamma and others did not understand me, that would be tiresome for me, that would be troublesome to me.’

original: Apissu maṁ, rājakumāra, imā anacchariyā gāthāyo paṭibhaṁsu pubbe assutapubbā:🔽‘Kicchena me adhigataṁ,
analyzed: ma rāja kumāraḥ imāḥ anacchariyāḥ gāthāyaḥ pubbe a ssuta pubbā  kicchena me adhigata
translated: Then, prince, these verses, unspoken in the past, unheard before, occurred to me spontaneously:🔽‘What I have attained is hard to obtain,

original: halaṁ dāni pakāsituṁ;
analyzed: halam dāni pakāsitu
translated: and it is hard for me to teach it.

original: Rāgadosaparetehi,
analyzed: rāga dosa paretā ihi
translated: Those who are overcome by lust and hatred

original: nāyaṁ dhammo susambudho.
analyzed: na ayam dhammo su sambudho
translated: will not understand this Dhamma.🔽It goes against the stream,🔽is profound, and hard to see, subtle, and can be understood only by the wise.

original: Paṭisotagāmiṁ nipuṇaṁ,🔽gambhīraṁ duddasaṁ aṇuṁ;🔽Rāgarattā na dakkhanti,
analyzed: paṭisota gāmim nipuṇa  gambhīram duddasam aṇu  rāga rattāḥ na dakkhanti
translated: Those who delight in existence,

original: tamokhandhena āvuṭā’ti.
analyzed: tamaḥ khandhena
translated: ensnared by the mass of darkness, will not see it.’

original: Itiha me, rājakumāra, paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati no dhammadesanāya.
analyzed: iti ha me rāja kumāra paṭisañcikkhataḥ appa ussukka tāya cittam namati no dhamma desanāya
translated: So, Prince, as I was reflecting thus, my mind inclined to inaction, not to teaching the Dhamma.

original: Atha kho, rājakumāra, brahmuno sahampatissa mama cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya etadahosi:🔽‘nassati vata bho loko; vinassati vata bho loko. Yatra hi nāma tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati no dhammadesanāyā’ti.🔽Atha kho, rājakumāra, brahmā sahampati—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā
analyzed: atha kho rāja kumāra brahmunaḥ sahampatissa mama cetasā cetaḥ upari vitakka maññāya etat ahosi  nassati vata bho lokaḥ vinassati vata bho lokaḥ yatra hi nāma tathāgatassa arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa appa ussukka tāya cittam namati no dhamma desanāya ati  atha khalu rāja kumāra brahmā sahampati seyyathā api nāma balavā purisaḥ samiñjitam vā
translated: Then, Prince, Brahmā Sahampati knew with his mind the thought in the mind of the Perfect One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha.

original: bāhaṁ pasāreyya pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—brahmaloke antarahito mama purato pāturahosi.
analyzed: bāham pasāreyya pasāritam vā bāham samiñjeyya evam eva brahma loke antara hitaḥ mama puratas
translated: Then, just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm, so did Brahmā Sahampati vanish from the Brahmā world and appear in front of the Perfect One.🔽Then, Prince, Brahmā Sahampati, after arranging his upper robe on one shoulder,

original: Atha kho, rājakumāra, brahmā sahampati ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yenāhaṁ tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā maṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu rāja kumāra brahmā sahampati ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā yena aham tena añjalim mam etat avoca
translated: and extending his hands in reverential salutation, said this to me:

original: ‘desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṁ, desetu sugato dhammaṁ.
analyzed: desetu bhante bhagavā dhamma desetu sugataḥ dhamma
translated: ‘May the Fortunate One teach the Dhamma, may the Happy One teach the Dhamma,

original: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā assavanatāya dhammassa parihāyanti;
analyzed: santi sattā appara jakkha jātikā assavana tāya dhammassa parihāyanti
translated: There are beings with little dust on the eyes who are perishing through not hearing the Dhamma;

original: bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro’ti.
analyzed: bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro ti
translated: there will be those who will understand the Dhamma.’

original: Idamavoca, rājakumāra, brahmā sahampati;
analyzed: idam avoca rāja kumāra brahmā sahampati
translated: This, Prince, was what Brahmā Sahampati said.

original: idaṁ vatvā athāparaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: idam vatvā atha aparam etat avoca
translated: Having said this, he further said this:

original: ‘Pāturahosi magadhesu pubbe,
analyzed: pāturahosi magadhesu pubbe
translated: ‘In the past, in the Magadhans,

original: Dhammo asuddho samalehi cintito;
analyzed: dhammaḥ asuddhaḥ samalehi cintitaḥ
translated: the Dhamma was impure, thought out by those with defilements.

original: Apāpuretaṁ amatassa dvāraṁ,
analyzed: apāpuretam amatassa dvāra
translated: Open this door to the Deathless

original: Suṇantu dhammaṁ vimalenānubuddhaṁ.
analyzed: suṇantu dhammam vimalena anubuddha
translated: so that they may hear the Dhamma discovered by the stainless one.

original: Sele yathā pabbatamuddhaniṭṭhito,
analyzed: sele yathā pabbata muddha niṭṭhito
translated: Just as one standing on the summit of a mountain🔽would see the people on all sides,

original: Yathāpi passe janataṁ samantato;
analyzed: yathā api passe janatam samantataḥ
translated: so too, you who are wise, having ascended

original: Tathūpamaṁ dhammamayaṁ sumedha,🔽Pāsādamāruyha samantacakkhu.
analyzed: tathūpamam dhamma mayam sumedha  pāsādam āruyha samanta cakkhu
translated: the Dhamma-palace, all-seeing,

original: Sokāvatiṇṇaṁ janatamapetasoko,
analyzed: soka avatiṇṇam janatam apeta sokaḥ
translated: look down on the people overcome by birth and old age,

original: Avekkhassu jātijarābhibhūtaṁ;🔽Uṭṭhehi vīra vijitasaṅgāma,
analyzed: avekkhassu jāti jarā abhibhūta  uṭṭhehi vīra vijita saṅgāma
translated: who are overcome by sorrow, who are without sorrow.🔽Arise, O hero, O victor in battle,

original: Satthavāha aṇaṇa vicara loke;
analyzed: satthavāha aṇaṇa vicara loke
translated: O caravan leader, go on your way through the world without debt,

original: Desassu bhagavā dhammaṁ,
analyzed: desassu bhagavā dhamma
translated: The Fortunate One should teach the Dhamma,

original: Aññātāro bhavissantī’ti.
analyzed: aññātāraḥ bhavissanti iti
translated: there will be those who will understand the Dhamma.’

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, rājakumāra, brahmuno ca ajjhesanaṁ viditvā sattesu ca kāruññataṁ paṭicca buddhacakkhunā lokaṁ volokesiṁ.🔽Addasaṁ kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra, buddhacakkhunā lokaṁ volokento satte apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe
analyzed: atha khvā āha rāja kumāra brahmuno ca ajjhesanam viditvā sattesu ca kāruñña tam paṭicca buddha cakkhunā lokam volokesi  addasam kho aha rāja kumāra buddha cakkhunā lokam volokento satte apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe
translated: and I saw beings having much passion and having little passion,🔽having much hate and having little hate,🔽having much delusion and having little delusion,🔽having gross defilements and having subtle defilements,

original: tikkhindriye mudindriye svākāre dvākāre suviññāpaye duviññāpaye appekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvine🔽viharante, appekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante.
analyzed: tikkhindriye mud indriye su ākāre dvi ākāre su viññāpaye du viññāpaye appekacce para loka vajja bhaya dassāvine  viharante appekacce na para loka vajja bhaya dassāvine viharante
translated: having good qualities and having bad qualities,🔽having few good qualities and having many good qualities,🔽easy to instruct and hard to instruct,🔽and able and not able to explain what they have learned.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma uppaliniyaṁ vā paduminiyaṁ vā puṇḍarīkiniyaṁ vā appekaccāni uppalāni🔽vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake saṁvaḍḍhāni udakānuggatāni antonimuggaposīni,
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma uppaliniyam vā paduminiyam vā puṇḍarīkiniyam vā appekaccāni uppalāni  vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake savaḍḍhāni udaka anuggatāni antonimugga posīni
translated: Just as in a pond of blue or red or white lotuses,🔽some lotuses that are born and grow in the water thrive immersed in the water without rising out of it,

original: appekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake saṁvaḍḍhāni
analyzed: appekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake savaḍḍhāni
translated: and some other lotuses that are born and grow in the water rest on the water’s surface,

original: udakānuggatāni samodakaṁ ṭhitāni, appekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni
analyzed: udaka anuggatāni samodakam ṭhitāni appekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni
translated: and some of the lotuses were growing in the water, thriving in the water, and not having come out of the water, they were flourishing without standing up out of the water,

original: vā udake jātāni udake saṁvaḍḍhāni udakā accuggamma ṭhitāni anupalittāni udakena;
analyzed: vā udake jātāni udake savaḍḍhāni udakā accuggamma ṭhitāni an upalittāni udakena
translated: and some of the lotuses were growing in the water, thriving in the water, and having come out of the water, they were standing up without being soiled by the water.

original: evameva kho ahaṁ, rājakumāra; buddhacakkhunā lokaṁ volokento addasaṁ satte apparajakkhe
analyzed: evam eva kho aha rāja kumāra buddha cakkhunā lokam volokentaḥ addasam satte apparajakkhe
translated: So too, Prince, I surveyed the world with the eye of a Buddha, and I saw beings with little dust on their eyes

original: mahārajakkhe tikkhindriye mudindriye svākāre dvākāre suviññāpaye duviññāpaye, appekacce
analyzed: mahārajakkhe tikkhindriye mud indriye su ākāre dvi ākāre su viññāpaye du viññāpaye appekacce
translated: and with much dust on their eyes, with keen faculties and with dull faculties, with good qualities and with bad qualities, easy to teach and hard to teach,

original: paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante, appekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante.
analyzed: paraloka vajja bhaya dassāvine viharante appekacce na paraloka vajja bhaya dassāvine viharante
translated: and some who dwelt seeing fear and blame in the other world.

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, rājakumāra, brahmānaṁ sahampatiṁ gāthāya paccabhāsiṁ:
analyzed: atha khvā āha rāja kumāra brahmānam sahampatim gāthāya paccabhāsi
translated: Then, Prince, I spoke to Brahmā Sahampati with a verse:

original: ‘Apārutā tesaṁ amatassa dvārā,
analyzed: apārutā tesam amatassa dvārā
translated: ‘The doors to the Deathless have been opened for those who have ears;

original: Ye sotavanto pamuñcantu saddhaṁ;
analyzed: ye sotavantaḥ pamuñcantu saddha
translated: Let those who have faith go in!

original: Vihiṁsasaññī paguṇaṁ na bhāsiṁ,
analyzed: vihisa saññī paguṇam na bhāsi
translated: I have not spoken the Dhamma to those who are heedless,

original: Dhammaṁ paṇītaṁ manujesu brahme’ti.
analyzed: dhammam paṇītam manujesu brahmā iti
translated: But to those who are fearful of wrongdoing, O Brahmā.’

original: Atha kho, rājakumāra, brahmā sahampati ‘katāvakāso khomhi bhagavatā dhammadesanāyā’ti maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
analyzed: atha kho rāja kumāra brahmā sahampati kata avakāsaḥ kho mhi bhagavatā dhamma desanāya ati mam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā tattha iva antaradhāyi
translated: Then, Prince, Brahmā Sahampati, knowing: ‘I have been given an opportunity by the Lord to speak’, after worshipping and circumambulating me, vanished right there.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: Then, Prince, this occurred to me:

original: ‘kassa nu kho ahaṁ paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ?
analyzed: kassa nu kho aham paṭhamam dhammam deseyya
translated: ‘To whom first should I teach the Dhamma?

original: Ko imaṁ dhammaṁ khippameva ājānissatī’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ imam dhammam khippam eva ājānissati iti
translated: Who will be able to understand the Dhamma quickly?’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: Then, Prince, this occurred to me:

original: ‘ayaṁ kho āḷāro kālāmo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī dīgharattaṁ apparajakkhajātiko.
analyzed: ayam kho āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ paṇḍitaḥ viyattaḥ medhāvī dīgharattam appara jakkha jātiko
translated: ‘This Āḷāra Kālāma is wise, learned, intelligent, the person who for a long time has been of little dust and dirt on the eyes.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ āḷārassa kālāmassa paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ;
analyzed: yat nūna aham āḷārassa kālāmassa paṭhamam dhammam deseyya
translated: Well now, I will teach the Dhamma first to Āḷāra Kālāma;

original: so imaṁ dhammaṁ khippameva ājānissatī’ti.
analyzed: saḥ imam dhammam khippam eva ājānissati iti
translated: he will be able to understand the Dhamma quickly.’

original: Atha kho maṁ, rājakumāra, devatā upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu ma rāja kumāra devatāḥ upasaṅkamitvā etat avoca
translated: Then, Prince, a deity approached me, and after approaching he said this to me:

original: ‘sattāhakālaṅkato, bhante, āḷāro kālāmo’ti.
analyzed: sattāha kālaṅkataḥ bhante āḷāro kālāmo ti
translated: ‘Lord, Āḷāra Kālāma died seven days ago.’

original: Ñāṇañca pana me dassanaṁ udapādi:
analyzed: ñāṇam ca pana me dassanam udapādi
translated: And knowledge and insight arose in me:

original: ‘sattāhakālaṅkato āḷāro kālāmo’ti.
analyzed: sattāha kālaṅkataḥ āḷāro kālāmo ti
translated: ‘Āḷāra Kālāma died seven days ago.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: Then, Prince, this occurred to me:

original: ‘mahājāniyo kho āḷāro kālāmo.
analyzed: mahā jāniyaḥ kho āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ
translated: ‘Āḷāra Kālāma was very learned.

original: Sace hi so imaṁ dhammaṁ suṇeyya, khippameva ājāneyyā’ti.
analyzed: sace hi saḥ imam dhammam suṇeyya khippam eva ājāneyya ati
translated: If he had heard this teaching, he would have understood it quickly.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘kassa nu kho ahaṁ paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ?
analyzed: kassa nu kho aham paṭhamam dhammam deseyya
translated: ‘To whom should I teach the Dhamma first?

analyzed: kaḥ imam dhammam khippam eva ājānissati iti
translated: Who will understand this teaching quickly?’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: I thought:🔽‘This Uddaka Rāmaputta is very learned…

original: ‘ayaṁ kho udako rāmaputto paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī dīgharattaṁ apparajakkhajātiko.🔽Yannūnāhaṁ udakassa rāmaputtassa paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ;
analyzed: ayam kho udakaḥ rāmaputtaḥ paṇḍitaḥ viyattaḥ medhāvī dīgharattam appara jakkha jātikaḥ  yat nūna aham udakassa rāmaputtassa paṭhamam dhammam deseyya
translated: Let me teach him the Dhamma first.

original: so imaṁ dhammaṁ khippameva ājānissatī’ti.
analyzed: saḥ imam dhammam khippam eva ājānissati iti
translated: He will understand it quickly.’

original: Atha kho maṁ, rājakumāra, devatā upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu ma rāja kumāra devatāḥ upasaṅkamitvā etat avoca
translated: Then a deity came to me and said:

original: ‘abhidosakālaṅkato, bhante, udako rāmaputto’ti.
analyzed: abhidosakālaṅkataḥ bhante udakaḥ rāmaputto ti
translated: ‘Sir, Uddaka Rāmaputta died yesterday evening.’

original: Ñāṇañca pana me dassanaṁ udapādi:
analyzed: ñāṇam ca pana me dassanam udapādi
translated: And knowledge and insight arose in me:

original: ‘abhidosakālaṅkato udako rāmaputto’ti.
analyzed: udakaḥ rāmaputto ti
translated: ‘Uddaka Rāmaputta died yesterday evening.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘mahājāniyo kho udako rāmaputto.
analyzed: mahājāniyaḥ kho udakaḥ rāmaputto
translated: ‘Uddaka Rāmaputta was very learned…

original: Sace hi so imaṁ dhammaṁ suṇeyya, khippameva ājāneyyā’ti.
analyzed: sace hi saḥ imam dhammam suṇeyya khippam eva ājāneyya ati
translated: If he were to hear this Dhamma, he would quickly understand it.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: Then, Prince, I thought:

original: ‘kassa nu kho ahaṁ paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ?
analyzed: kassa nu kho aham paṭhamam dhammam deseyya
translated: ‘To whom should I first teach the Dhamma?

original: Ko imaṁ dhammaṁ khippameva ājānissatī’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ imam dhammam khippam eva ājānissati iti
translated: Who will be able to understand the Dhamma quickly?’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: Then, Prince, I thought:🔽‘The group-of-five monks were very helpful to me.

original: ‘bahukārā kho me pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū ye maṁ padhānapahitattaṁ upaṭṭhahiṁsu.
analyzed: bahu kārāḥ kho me pañcavaggiyāḥ bhikkhū ye mama padhāna pahita ttam upaṭṭhahisu
translated: They looked after me when I was resolute on striving.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ pañcavaggiyānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham pañcavaggiyānam bhikkhūnam paṭhamam dhammam deseyyanti
translated: Let me first teach them the Dhamma.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, rājakumāra, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa rāja kumāraḥ
translated: Then, Prince, I thought:

original: ‘kahaṁ nu kho etarahi pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū viharantī’ti.
analyzed: kaham nu kho etarahi pañcavaggiyāḥ bhikkhū viharanti iti
translated: ‘Where are the group-of-five monks dwelling right now?’

original: Addasaṁ khvāhaṁ, rājakumāra, dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena pañcavaggiye bhikkhū bārāṇasiyaṁ viharante isipatane migadāye.
analyzed: addasam khvā aha rāja kumāra dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena pañcavaggiye bhikkhū bārāṇasiyam viharante isipatane migadāye
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses that of (normal) men, I saw that the group-of-five monks were dwelling near Bārāṇasī, in the Deer Park at Isipatana.

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, rājakumāra, uruvelāyaṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena bārāṇasī tena cārikaṁ pakkamiṁ.
analyzed: atha khvā āha rāja kumāraḥ uruvelāyam yathābhirantam viharitvā yena bārāṇasī tena cārikam pakkami
translated: Then, Prince, having dwelt in Uruvelā for as long as I wanted, I set out on a walking tour towards Bārāṇasī.

original: Addasā kho maṁ, rājakumāra, upako ājīvako antarā ca gayaṁ antarā ca bodhiṁ addhānamaggappaṭipannaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho ma rāja kumāraḥ upakaḥ ājīvakaḥ antarā ca gayam antarā ca bodhim addhāna magga ppaṭipanna
translated: Upaka the Ājīvaka saw me walking along the highway between Gaya and the Bodhi tree.

original: Disvāna maṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvāna mama etat avoca
translated: When he saw me, he said to me,

original: ‘vippasannāni kho te, āvuso, indriyāni, parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
analyzed: vippasannāni kho te āvuso indriyāni parisuddhaḥ chavi vaṇṇaḥ pariyodāto
translated: ‘Your faculties, friend, are clear and your complexion pure and bright.

original: Kaṁsi tvaṁ, āvuso, uddissa pabbajito? Ko vā te satthā? Kassa vā tvaṁ dhammaṁ rocesī’ti?
analyzed: kasi tvaḥ āvuso uddissa pabbajitaḥ kaḥ vā te satthā kassa vā tvam dhammam rocesi iti
translated: On whose account have you gone forth? Who is your teacher? In whose Dhamma do you delight?’

original: Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, rājakumāra, upakaṁ ājīvakaṁ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsiṁ:
analyzed: evam vutte aha rāja kumāraḥ upakam ājīvakam gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi
translated: When this was said, I replied to Upaka the Ājīvaka in stanzas:

original: ‘Sabbābhibhū sabbavidūhamasmi,
analyzed: sabba abhibhū sabba vid ūham asmi
translated: ‘I am one who has overcome all things,

original: Sabbesu dhammesu anūpalitto;
analyzed: sabbesu dhammesu an upalittaḥ
translated: who has passed beyond all things.

original: Sabbañjaho taṇhākkhaye vimutto,
analyzed: sabbañjaho taṇhā khaye vimutto
translated: I am one who has renounced all, liberated by the destruction of craving,

original: Sayaṁ abhiññāya kamuddiseyyaṁ.
analyzed: sayam abhiññāya kam uddiseyya
translated: having directly known this for myself.

original: Na me ācariyo atthi,🔽sadiso me na vijjati;🔽Sadevakasmiṁ lokasmiṁ,
analyzed: na me ācariyaḥ atthi  sadisaḥ me na vijjati  sa devakasmin
translated: I have no teacher,🔽and I have no equal in this world with its gods;

original: natthi me paṭipuggalo.
analyzed: natthi me paṭipuggalaḥ
translated: there is no person whom I could honor🔽as a teacher.

original: Ahañhi arahā loke,
analyzed: ahañhi arahā loke
translated: I am the Worthy One in the world,

original: ahaṁ satthā anuttaro;
analyzed: aham satthā anuttaraḥ
translated: I am the Unsurpassed Teacher;

original: Ekomhi sammāsambuddho,
analyzed: ekaḥ mhi sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: I alone am fully enlightened,

original: sītibhūtosmi nibbuto.🔽Dhammacakkaṁ pavattetuṁ,
analyzed: sīti bhūtaḥ asmi nibbutaḥ  dhammacakkam pavattetu
translated: cooled, extinguished.

original: Gacchāmi kāsinaṁ puraṁ;
analyzed: gacchāmi kāsinam pura
translated: I will go to the city of the Kasis🔽to set rolling the wheel of Dhamma.

original: Andhībhūtasmiṁ lokasmiṁ,
analyzed: andhībhūtasmin
translated: The world is blind and sightless,

original: Āhañchaṁ amatadundubhin’ti.
analyzed: āhan śam amatadundubhinti
translated: I will beat the drum of the deathless.’

original: ‘Yathā kho tvaṁ, āvuso, paṭijānāsi arahasi anantajino’ti.
analyzed: yathā kho tvam āvuso paṭijānāsi a rahasi
translated: ‘You are a victor, friend, in the sense in which you say it.’

original: ‘Mādisā ve jinā honti,
analyzed: mādisā ve jināḥ honti
translated: ‘Those like me are victors,

original: ye pattā āsavakkhayaṁ;
analyzed: ye pattāḥ āsava kkhaya
translated: who have attained the destruction of the pollutants.

original: Jitā me pāpakā dhammā,
analyzed: jitāḥ me pāpakāḥ dhammā
translated: I have conquered evil qualities,

original: tasmāhamupaka jino’ti.
analyzed: tasmāt aham upaka jinoti
translated: therefore I am a victor.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, rājakumāra, upako ājīvako ‘hupeyyapāvuso’ti vatvā sīsaṁ okampetvā ummaggaṁ gahetvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: evam vutte rāja kumāraḥ upakaḥ ājīvakaḥ hupeyya pāvuso ti vatvā sīsam okampetvā ummaggam gahetvā pakkāmi
translated: When this was said, Upaka the Ājīvaka said: ‘May it be so, friend.’ And shaking his head, he took a side road and left.

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, rājakumāra, anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena bārāṇasī isipatanaṁ migadāyo yena pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamiṁ.
analyzed: atha khvā āha rāja kumāra anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena bārāṇasī isipatanam migadāyaḥ yena pañcavaggiyāḥ bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then, Prince, wandering by stages, I eventually came to Bārāṇasī, to the Deer Park at Isipatana, and to the group-of-five monks.

original: Addasaṁsu kho maṁ, rājakumāra, pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū dūratova āgacchantaṁ.
analyzed: addasasu kho ma rāja kumāra pañcavaggiyāḥ bhikkhū dūratas vā āgacchanta
translated: The group-of-five monks saw me coming off in the distance,

original: Disvāna aññamaññaṁ saṇṭhapesuṁ:
analyzed: disvāna aññam aññam saṇṭhapesu
translated: and on seeing me, they agreed among themselves:

original: ‘ayaṁ kho, āvuso, samaṇo gotamo āgacchati bāhulliko padhānavibbhanto āvatto bāhullāya.
analyzed: ayam khalu āvuso samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ āgacchati bāhullikaḥ padhāna vibbhantaḥ āvattaḥ bāhullāya
translated: ‘Friends, here comes the ascetic Gotama who lives luxuriously,

original: So neva abhivādetabbo, na paccuṭṭhātabbo, nāssa pattacīvaraṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ;
analyzed: saḥ na iva abhivādetabbaḥ na paccuṭṭhātabbaḥ na assa patta cīvaram
translated: You shouldn’t bow down to him, stand up to greet him, or raise your joined palms to him.

original: api ca kho āsanaṁ ṭhapetabbaṁ—sace so ākaṅkhissati nisīdissatī’ti.

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti;

translated: ‘That Blessed One is an Accomplished One, a Fully Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Well-Farer, a Knower of the worlds, an unsurpassed trainer of those people fit to be tamed, a Teacher of gods and men, a Buddha, a Blessed One.’

original: appābādho hoti appātaṅko samavepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgato nātisītāya nāccuṇhāya majjhimāya padhānakkhamāya;

translated: He is wise. He possesses the wisdom that discerns arising and passing away, which is noble and penetrative and leads to the complete ending of suffering.

original: Imāni kho, rājakumāra, pañca padhāniyaṅgāni.
analyzed: imāni khalu rājakumāra pañca
translated: These are the five factors of striving.

original: Imehi, rājakumāra, pañcahi padhāniyaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu tathāgataṁ vināyakaṁ labhamāno—

original: yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyya satta vassāni.

original: Evaṁ vutte, bodhi rājakumāro bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
