original: “aho buddho, aho dhammo, aho dhammassa svākkhātatā.
analyzed: aho buddhaḥ aho dhammaḥ aho dhammassa su ākkhāta tā
translated: “Oh the Buddha! Oh the Dhamma! Oh how well the Dhamma is taught!

original: Yatra hi nāma sāyamanusiṭṭho pāto visesaṁ adhigamissati, pātamanusiṭṭho sāyaṁ visesaṁ adhigamissatī”ti.
analyzed: yatra hi nāma sāyam anusiṭṭhaḥ pātaḥ visesam adhigamissati pātam anusiṭṭhaḥ sāyam visesam adhigamissati iti
translated: For he will have made progress in the morning by what he is taught in the evening, and in the evening by what he is taught in the morning.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, sañjikāputto māṇavo bodhiṁ rājakumāraṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte sañjikāputtaḥ māṇavaḥ bodhim rāja kumāram etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the brahmin student Sanjikaputta said to Prince Bodhi:

original: “evameva panāyaṁ bhavaṁ bodhi:
analyzed: evam eva pana ayam bhavam bodhi
translated: “So it is, Prince Bodhi, so it is!

original: ‘aho buddho, aho dhammo, aho dhammassa svākkhātatā’ti ca vadeti;
analyzed: aho buddhaḥ aho dhammaḥ aho dhammassa su ākkhāta tā ati ca vadeti
translated: You say: ‘Oh, the Buddha! Oh, the Dhamma! Oh, how well expounded is the Dhamma!’

original: atha ca pana na taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchati dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañcā”ti.
analyzed: atha ca pana na tam bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchati dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca ati
translated: But you do not go for refuge to that Master Gotama, to the Dhamma, and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.”

original: “Mā hevaṁ, samma sañjikāputta, avaca; mā hevaṁ, samma sañjikāputta, avaca.🔽Sammukhā metaṁ, samma sañjikāputta, ayyāya sutaṁ, sammukhā paṭiggahitaṁ”.
analyzed: mā ha iva samma sañjikāputta avaca mā ha iva samma sañjikāputta avaca  sammukhā meta samma sañjikāputta ayyāya suta sammukhā paṭiggahita
translated: “Do not say so, dear Sanjikaputta, do not say so.🔽I have heard and understood from the Master himself, dear Sanjikaputta, that:

original: “Ekamidaṁ, samma sañjikāputta, samayaṁ bhagavā kosambiyaṁ viharati ghositārāme.
analyzed: ekam idam samma sañjikāputta samayam bhagavā kosambiyam viharati ghosita ārāme
translated: “On one occasion, dear Sanjikaputta, the Blessed One was dwelling at Kosambi in Ghosita’s Park.

original: Atha kho me ayyā kucchimatī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho me ayyā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu me ayyā kucchimatī yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnā khalu me ayyā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then my mother, being pregnant, went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: ‘yo me ayaṁ, bhante, kucchigato kumārako vā kumārikā vā so bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchati dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: yaḥ me bhante kucchi gataḥ kumārakaḥ vā kumārikā vā saḥ bhagavantam saraṇam gacchati dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: and said, ‘Sir, the boy or girl in my womb has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.

original: Upāsakaṁ taṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan’ti.
analyzed: upāsakam tam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: Please remember him or her as a lay follower who has gone for refuge from today until the end of samsara.’

original: Ekamidaṁ, samma sañjikāputta, samayaṁ bhagavā idheva bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.
analyzed: ekam idam samma sañjikāputta samayam bhagavā idha iva bhaggesu viharati susumāra gire bhesakaḷā vane migadāye
translated: Once, my dear Sañjikāputta, the Buddha was staying here in the country of the Bhaggas at Sumsumāragira in the Bhesakaḷā Grove, the deer park.

original: Atha kho maṁ dhāti aṅkena haritvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho maṁ dhāti bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho mam dhāti aṅkena haritvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi ekamantam ṭhitā kho mam dhāti bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then my nurse carried me on her hip to the Buddha, bowed, and stood to one side. She said to the Buddha,

original: ‘ayaṁ, bhante, bodhi rājakumāro bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchati dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: bhante rāja kumāraḥ bhagavantam saraṇam gacchati dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: ‘Venerable Sir, Prince Bodhi goes for refuge to the Lord, to the Dhamma, and to the Sangha of monks.

original: Upāsakaṁ taṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan’ti.
analyzed: upāsakam tam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: May the Lord remember him as a lay-follower who has gone for refuge from this day forth as long as life shall last.’

original: Esāhaṁ, samma sañjikāputta, tatiyakampi bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha samma sañjikāputta tatiyakam pi bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: And for the third time I go for refuge to the Lord, to the Dhamma, and to the Sangha of monks.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: May the Lord remember me as a lay-follower who has gone for refuge from this day forth as long as life shall last.”

original: Bodhirājakumārasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: bodhirājakumāra suttam niṭṭhitam pañcama
translated: The Story of Prince Bodhi is finished.
